page.title: 06Ecology Birds
page.content: All the common birds are to be seen in and around Middleham and East Witton. Often to be seen are lapwings, oyster-catchers and curlews as they fly between their nests and the rich feeding grounds of the River Ure. A kingfisher was recently seen. Larks, yellow and pied wagtails, pippits and cuckoos can frequently be seen. On the Rivers Ure and Cover there are moorhen and coots, mallards, gulls, sand - martins and sometimes herons. House- martins nest under the eaves of houses . Tawny owls and barn owls are also seen. Woodpigeons, rooks, jackdaws and magpies are common. Pheasants are frequently killed by vehicles on the country roads.
